task_summary: Remove the lid from the pot, place the pot onto the plate, then grasp the spatula tool and push the pot toward the front edge of the table.

task_long_description.overview: A robot arm operates on a tabletop with a pot that has a lid, a round plate, and a spatula tool. The goal is threefold: first, expose the pot by removing its lid; second, pick up the pot and place it centered on the plate; third, use the spatula to push the pot forward to the near edge of the table. The robot should handle objects gently, maintain alignment during placement, and push in a straight line toward the operator-facing edge.
preconditions: Pot, pot lid, plate, and spatula are visible on the table
Workspace is clear enough for unobstructed arm motion
Gripper and tool-use routines are available
stepwise_plan: Perceive pot and compute a side grasp.
Grasp and lift the pot slightly.
Place the pot onto the plate and release.
Acquire the spatula with a top grasp.
Align to the pot and push toward the table front.
success_criteria: Lid no longer covering the pot
Pot rests stably on the plate
Pot translated forward toward the table edge by the push
failure_and_recovery: If lid removal slips: re-detect and retry opening.
If grasp fails: recompute grasp pose and reattempt.
If push deviates: realign to pot and repeat push with shorter distance.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the pot is on the plate and has been pushed toward the front along the table surface.

frame_3.now_evidence: Robot establishes a firm grasp on the pot near the plate region.
frame_3.predicts_next: Lift and placement onto the plate are imminent.

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Perceive a named object within a time budget.
Open or remove a container or its lid.
Compute grasp pose and store it on blackboard.
Execute a grasp using a stored pose.
Lift the currently held object by a distance.
Place an object on a named surface/area.
Back off to clear the workspace.
Align TCP relative to target within tolerance.
Use a held tool to push a target in a given direction and distance.

failure_modes: Lid not detected or slips during removal
Pot grasp unstable or collides with plate rim
Misaligned placement causing pot to topple
Push direction off from table-front axis
recovery_strategy: Re-run DetectObject then OpenContainer with a fresh approach
Recompute grasp pose and retry grasp
Retreat, realign, and re-place with lower press_force
assumptions: The plate in the scene is the intended support surface.
Front of table corresponds to image-bottom direction; mapped to direction_deg=270 for the push.
Lid is treated as a 'lid' container_type and removable via OpenContainer.

expected_success_criteria: Lid removed and not covering the pot
Pot centered and stable on the plate
Pot translated forward along table by push with spatula
